title: Gojek | Associate Software Engineer | L1 | Bengaluru
content:
* Education: MCA (Non-NIT) from India
* Years of Experience: 0 (2022 grad)
* Prior Experience:
	* For fresh grad, any related Internship/coop experience? 2 Internships (2 months + 5 months)
* Date of the Offer: June 2022
* Company: Gojek/GoTo Financial
* Title/Level: Associate Software Engineer/L1
* Location: Bengaluru
* Salary: INR 21.25 L
* Relocation Bonus: INR 35k + 15-30 days accomodation + 1 way flight (when required) (extended to your 
spouse and up to 3 dependents.) + ground transportation.
* Signing Bonus: None
* Stock bonus: $10k worth stock options (No RSUs) vested over 4 years (25% yearly), 1 year cliff
* Performance Bonus: 
	* 20% of base (~INR 4L) for 5/5 rating
	* 15% of base for 4/5 rating
	* 10% of base (~INR 2L) for 3/5 rating
* Total comp (Salary + Bonus + Stock): ~ INR 31 L (includes ~50k gratuity amount)
* Benefits: 
	* INR 54k worth reimbursements related to Phone, Internet, Books, Health & Wellness in ratio (2:4:1:2).
	* Health insurance (INR 6L), Life insurance (INR 65L), and Group Accident insurance (6 X CTC), including tax 18% all covered by the company.
* Other details: 12% employer contribution to PF (~INR 1.2L, not taxable).
* Extra details: off-campus offer

I'd like to thank entire Leetcode community, your posts and comments directly or indirectly helped me reach here.

title: Amazon | SDE1 | Gurgaon
content:
Date of offer: June, 2022
Company: Amazon
Title/Level: SDE1
Location: Gurgaon
Expereince Years: 1.9 yrs

Base Salary: **21LPA**
joining Bonus: **9.5LPA** (**5.2LPA** 1st yr + **4.3LPA** 2nd yr)
Stocks: Worth **12LPA** (standard vesting schedule)
Relocation: **1.5L**
Benefits: 1100rs Sodexo + 4000rs transport (if not company availed) + other standard benefits (per month basis)
**Final Annual Compensation - Base + J.B = 26.2LPA (excluding stocks)**
I had to negotiate to get to this number but since I didn't have any competing offers, they said this is the max they can give at this level. (This also varies based on location, Bengaluru is a lot competitive so for the same level they might give employee there a bit high.)

**Previous Compensation: 19Lpa fixed + 1.5L performace bonus. (12L worth of stocks with 33% vesting each year).**

Note: I know that the overall TC is not increased by much but I wanted to switch my domain before its too late (Current company domain is very niche so it would have been difficult to move once I get more experience in that field).

I'll write about my Interview experience soon.

title: Amazon | SDE2 | L5 | Bangalore
content:
Education: Tier 2 College
Years of Experience: 4
Current Company: Retail and E-commerce
Date of the Offer: June 2022
Current Total Comp: INR 39,00,000 (*Base + Perf Bonus+ RSUs: 29+5+5*)

**Offer Details:**
Company: Amazon
Title/Level: SDE2 (L5)
Location: Bangalore
Salary: INR 45,00,000
Sign-on Bonuses: INR 16,00,000 (1st year) + INR 13,00,000 (2nd year)
Stock bonus: ~420 Units(Amazon stock split 1 -> 20) vesting over 4 years (as per Amazon's standard RSU plan 5/15/40/40)
Total comp for 1st year (Salary + Bonus + Stock): ~ INR 62,67,666
Total comp for 2nd year (Salary + Bonus + Stock): ~ INR 63,02,997
Benefits: Standard Amazon Benefits

Note: After negotiation, the Sign-on bonus is revised from 14L to 16L (First Year) and 11L to 13L (Second year) without any competing offers.

When compared to other offers on leetcode, I feel my sign on bonus can be further revised but the recruiter said he doesn't have any more budget considering the current team's parity.

Need suggestions for negotiationg these numbers.

title: CONFLUENT | SDE2 | BLR
content:
Date of the Offer: June 2022
Company: Confluent
Title/Level: SDE2
Location: BLR
Expereince Years: 3
Previous Company: Amazon
Base Salary: 50L
Variable: Free Lunch and transport.
Benefits: Compulsory 1 Friday off every month apart from PTOs / Sick Leaves.
Performance: 5L 
joining Bonus: 0L
Stock Bonus - 115K USD (~90L) vested in 4 years (1/4 per year). They also have decent refreshers.
Final Annual Compensation - Base + bonus + stock  = ~78LPA every year assuming no hike / refresher.

Had competing offers from, Google L4, Uber L4, Rippling L6, Rubrik SDE2, Linkedin Software Engineer. 
All in very similar ranges, but quality of work and team-culture wise, I picked Confluent.

Interview Exp: https://leetcode.com/discuss/interview-experience/2151821/Confluent-SDE2

title: Sharechat | Livspace | Ninjacart | Publicis Sapient | Frontend
content:
Education: Tier 2 - CSE
Years of Experience: 1 year 9 months
Prev Comp: 6.6 LPA (Service Based)

This is my journey from **6LPA to 30LPA**+

I started off my journey in November, and started off with leetcoding a little bit. I was always motivated by the multiple offers people were sharing here. I was motivated to an extent but often wondered if I will be able to get such good offers or if I'd be forever stuck in a service-based company.

I always saw people sharing the offers they received but never the companies they got rejected by, I want to share the list of the companies that rejected me so that anyone who's struggling to get a good job can take this away as a motivation that what doesn't kill you only makes you stronger\xA0 

1) Cisco - Online Assessment
2) Supr Daily - 2nd of total 3 rounds.
3) ZestMoney - Final technical round
4) Paypal - 1st round
5) SAP - 4th and final Managerial round
6) BharatPe - 1st round
7) Rupifi - 4th and final technical round
8) Rippling - 1st round
9) Media.net - 4th and final technical round
10) Deutsche Telekom - 2nd technical round
11) Flipkart - 3rd technical round
 
 PS: I am probably forgetting the names of a few companies here :P

Here's the list of offers received in order: 

	Company: Publicis Sapient
	Title/Level: ALT - 2
	Location: Noida
	Salary: 10L
	Yearly Bonus: 1L

//

	Company: Ninjacart
	Title/Level: SDE-1 (Frontend)
	Location: Bangalore
	Salary: 14
	Yearly Bonus: 1.2L

//

	Company: Livspace
	Title/Level: SDE-1 (Frontend)
	Location: Bangalore
	Salary: 23L
	Joining Bonus: 2L + 2L (with 1st month salary and 12th month salary)
	Stock Bonus: 13.8 worth esops (Vested over 4 years)

//

	//After renegotiation
	
	Company: Ninjacart
	Title/Level: SDE-2 (Frontend)
	Location: Bangalore
	Salary: 26L
	Yearly Bonus: 2L
	Joining Bonus: 3L

//

	Company: Sharechat
	Title/Level: SDE-1
	Location: Bangalore
	Salary: 27L
	Yearly Bonus: 10% of fixed
	Joining Bonus: 3L
	ESOPS: 36 units (around 12L currently)
	Perks: 250rs worth zomato coupon everyday, 50k for WFH setup


Thanks for reading, have a good day!

title: Amazon | SDE-1 | Bangalore
content:
**Background:**
Education: Tier 2 College
Years of Experience: 9 months 
Prior Experience: 2021 grad working as SDE-1 in mnc
Date of the Offer: June 2022
Company: Amazon
Title/Level: SDE1
Location: Bangalore
Current Total Comp: INR 12,00,000

**Amazon offer:**
Salary: INR 22,00,000
Bonuses: INR 6,00,000 (1st year) + INR 4,50,000 (2nd year)
Stock bonus: 11 RSUs vesting over 4 years (as per Amazon's standard RSU plan 5/15/40/40)
Total comp for 1st year (Salary + Bonus + Stock): ~ INR 29,00,000
Benefits: Standard Amazon benefits

**Negotiation Tips:**
Negotiatiging for the right salary is really important. Think of negotitating as another round where you have to use your communication skills to get a good offer, which means you should take some time to prepare for this along with technical and behavioral rounds. Here are some tips to negotiate for a better offer:

1. Never accept the inital offer. There is always room for negotiation even if you do not hold any competing offers.
2. Be polite to your recruiter, they have to bat for you so that you can get a better offer.
2. Do some research on Leetcode to come up with the minimum amount acceptable to you.
3. When recruiter asks for expected salary, never mention the number. Always ask for the budget and use this no come up with your compensation. If they press you too much, ask 15% more than your minimum acceptable amount. You can also just tell them to give the best possible offer for the role.
4. If you are not happy with the numbers presented, do let them know that you are not happy with the offer and mention your achievements and how you would bring value into the organization to ask for more.

content:

Stock bonus: ~$70,000 vesting over 4 years (as per Amazon's standard RSU plan 5/15/40/40)
Total comp for 1st year (Salary + Bonus + Stock): ~ INR 70,00,000
Total comp for 2nd year (Salary + Bonus + Stock): ~ INR 72,50,000

title: Arcesium | SDE-1 | Hyderabad | March 2022
content:
* **Education**: B.Tech from NIT (ECE)
* **Years of Experience:** 1 Year 3 Months (2020 Graduate)
* **Previous TC:** 11 + 1 (JB) + 1 (1st Year RB) + 1 (2nd Year RB)
* **Date of the Offer:** March 2022
* **Company:** Arcesium
* **Title/Level:** SDE-1
* **Location:** Hyderabad, India
* **Base Pay:** 20,00,000 INR (Arcesium's PF Contribution, Gratuity included)
* **Target Bonus:** 1,50,000 - 2,50,000 INR (15%)
* **Long Term Incentive:** 10,00,000 INR (Vesting: 25%, 25%, 25%, 25%)
* **Relocation:**  Air Ticket + Reimbursement of Actual Expense for shifting personal Belongigns (50K for unmarried and 100K for Married) + 15 Days Stay
* **Other Details:** Had the call with HR in Feb last Week. Intial Offer was 18 LPA Base and 8L LTI. Asked for above compensastion. HR told that she will try. After this no update. I emailed them 1 - 2 times a week but no updates. After getting Amazon's offer, I stopped them to ask for update. A week after Amazon's offer, Got a call (On 29th March) from HR that this is the offer and said Sorry for being so late.

**Other Offers:**
* **Amazon:** https://leetcode.com/discuss/compensation/2135911/Amazon-or-SDE-1-or-Bangalore-or-March-2022
* **Google:** https://leetcode.com/discuss/compensation/2135877/Google-or-L3-or-Bangalore-or-April-2022

content:
